name: epm-input-schema
title: EPM Model Input Data Schema
description: Canonical schema for Energy Planning Model (EPM) input datasets packaged as a Frictionless Data Package. Each dataset is a resource (typically a CSV) described by a logical schema and optional layout metadata. Resources represent measures indexed by one or more dimension fields (e.g., zones, seasons, technologies, fuels). Dimension fields reference dedicated dimension resources via foreign keys (e.g., z→zcmap.z, c→zcamp.c, y→y.y, q/t/d→pHours, f/tech→pTechFuel). Some resources are stored in wide form: one dimension (usually year) is encoded in column headers; these resources declare `custom.format: "wide"`, `custom.dimensions: [<dimension>]`, and `custom.encoding.<dimension>.type: "columns"` (with `year` columns matching YYYY). The resource `schema` always describes the normalized long structure expected for processing: identifier dimension fields + the wide dimension field (year as integer when used) + a numeric `value` measure (with semantics and unit in `custom.value`).

custom.notes: Resource is stored in wide format (custom.format='wide'). The dimension 't' is encoded in the column headers. The logical processing form is long format with columns: q, d, t, value (where value is numeric).
